title.narrative: 5.4 INCREAS'D & SUSTAIN'D DEMAND FOR EDU

description.narrative: Output 5.4: By 2018, families and communities have strengthened capacities to create favourable conditions for increased and sustainable demand for education, which contributes to Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 5: By 2018, school-age children, particularly girls, children who live in rural areas and vulnerable children, have access to and make greater use of quality basic education services

participating-org.narrative: MINISTERE DE LA POSTE ET DES NOUVEL TECHNOLOGIES DE L INFORMATION

sector.narrative: Provision of training of school communities e.g. parent teacher associations, school management committees
Provision or procurement of multiple-levels (or alternative pathways of education) learning materials
System strengthening - community participation and social accountability, e.g. school management committees

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 5.4: By 2018, families and communities have strengthened capacities to create favourable conditions for increased andsustainable demand for education

description.narrative: In 2018, training for 2,200 school management committees and parental organization, reaching over 6,600 committee members, along with continued information campaigns on girls&39; education contributed to strengthening the capacity of families and communities to demand quality education and improved school environment | Status:Met | As-of Date:30/01/2019

title.narrative: Number of School Management Committees that have implemented local action plans for girls education
Proportion of school management committees in the 35 convergence municipalities that have recieved at least once during the year an information session on early childhood stimulation
Number of School Management Committees that organised extracurricular activities during the year with a view to improving the level of college students
Proportion of School Management Committees that organised at least one information campaign during the year on peace-building and combating violence in the school environment
Proportion of School Management Committees members at both Primary and lower Secondary, that received training on their roles and responsibilities

Service Delivery - Communities - School management committees (or parent teacher association or school communities or similar structure) whose capacity was developed through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
System Strengthening - Communities - Community (including students') participation in school management committees at primary and secondary levels - score (1-4), see guidance
Service Delivery - Children provided with individual (one-per-child) education/early learning materials through UNICEF-supported programmes - see guidance
